page.title: 05TRANSPORT WEST OF DORKING
page.content: 2 main routeways pass through Westcott and Wotton - the{A25 -a major {east-west route}and the{Reading to {Guildford railway line.}There are no stations in either village and therefore transport out of the area is by car or bus. Pupils of Sondes Place and Powell Corderoy travel to school by coach, paid for by parents, or on foot. In July 1985, a meeting was called by the{Village Association}because of mounting criticism over the local bus services to Westcott. The bus services to Westcott were reduced from April and the 773 operates only once every hour from{Guildford to Brighton.} Complaints expressed at the meeting: {"buses are infrequent/there is an {inadequate service to Dorking North {Station/buses were usually late and {passengers have to wait a long time."
